result.execSummary:
The defendant Lavana R Marx was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 2/1/17 and each month thereafter or penalty of 5 days jail for non-payment.  

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Lavana R Marx in court, in custody, with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant enters a guilty plea to count # 1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Rumpf makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. 
The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1:

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

___ 60 DAYS JAIL, Straight time (CREDIT - 0 days)

COSTS:  $268.00 + $250.00 DNA surcharge ($25/month commencing on 02/01/17).

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
